it.ma.polimi.briscola.model.briscola.twoplayers

Interface Briscola2PMatchConfig

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBriscola2PMatchConfig, Briscola2PFullMatchConfig, Briscola2PMinimalMatchConfig

    public interface Briscola2PMatchConfig
    Interface declaring all the methods a generic Briscol2PMatchConfiguration should provide

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DRAW
      The constant PLAYER0 is an index used to represent the Local Player (i.e. the human player on the local device)

      static int PLAYER1

    • Method Detail

      • countCardsOnSurface

        int countCardsOnSurface()
        Count the number of cards currently on surface.
        Returns:
        the int representing the number of cards currently on surface.

      • getNumberTurnsElapsed

        int getNumberTurnsElapsed()
        Gets number turns elapsed.
        Returns:
        the number turns elapsed

      • getCurrentPlayer

        int getCurrentPlayer()
        Gets current player.
        Returns:
        Index of the current player, is either the public final int PLAYER0 or PLAYER1 provided by this class

      • playCard

        void playCard(java.lang.String card)
        Play card. Removes the card represented by the String card from hand and puts it on the surface.
        Parameters:
        card - the String representing the card to be played (should be in hand of the current player!)

      • playCard

        void playCard(java.lang.Integer card)
        Play card. Removes the i-th card from the hand of the current player and puts it onto the surface.
        Parameters:
        card - the index of the card to be played (should be either CARD1,CARD2 or CARD3 of the public final ints provided by the Briscola2PHand class)

      • toggleCurrentPlayer

        void toggleCurrentPlayer()
        Toggle current player.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the currentPlayer has not been initialized

      • chooseRoundWinner

        int chooseRoundWinner()
        Choose round winner int, should be called at the end of the round, after clearSurface has been called.
        Returns:
        the int representing the round winner (either PLAYER0 or PLAYER1)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the surface is not filled (round is not finished), or if the surface is in an inconsistent state (i.e. does not satisfy any of the round winner evaluation rules)

      • clearSurface

        java.util.List<NeapolitanCard> clearSurface(int winner)
        Clear surface. Clears the surface and appends the cards on the surface to the pile of the winner.
        Parameters:
        winner - the winner index, is either the public final int PLAYER0 or PLAYER1 provided by this class
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the surface is not completely filled

      • setCurrentPlayer

        void setCurrentPlayer(int currentPlayer)
        Sets current player.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - the current player, should be either the public final int PLAYER0 or PLAYER1 provided by this class
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid player is specified.

      • chooseMatchWinner

        int chooseMatchWinner()
        Choose match winner, should be called after the end of the whole match.
        Returns:
        the int representing the player who won the match (PLAYER0,PLAYER1 or DRAW in case of draw)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if all 120 points are not in the player's piles

      • drawCardsNewRound

        java.util.List<NeapolitanCard> drawCardsNewRound()
        Draw cards for the new round. Should be called at the beginning of the round, after the current player has been set. If the deck is empty, the configuration is unaffected.

      • getHands

        java.util.List<Briscola2PHand> getHands()
        Gets hands.
        Returns:
        the hands

      • computeScore

        int computeScore(int playerIndex)
        Compute score examining the piles of the specified player (this class does not enforce the match end, since it could be called during the match, for instance, to show the current points of each player on the GUI)
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - the player index, should be either PLAYER0 or PLAYER1 provided by this class
        Returns:
        the int representing the score, computed summing the point values of the cards in the player's pile

      • getBriscola

        NeapolitanCard getBriscola()
        Gets the briscola.
        Returns:
        the briscola

      • setSurface

        void setSurface(Briscola2PSurface surface)
        Sets surface.
        Parameters:
        surface - the surface

      • getPile

        Briscola2PPile getPile(int playerIndex)
        Gets pile of the i-th player
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - the player index, should be the public final int PLAYER0 or PLAYER1 provided by this class
        Returns:
        the pile

      • getSurface

        Briscola2PSurface getSurface()
        Gets surface.
        Returns:
        the surface

      • getBriscolaSuit

        java.lang.String getBriscolaSuit()
        Gets briscola suit.
        Returns:
        the briscola suit, among NeapolitanCardSuit enum values

      • setPile

        void setPile(int i,
             Briscola2PPile pile)
        Set pile of the i-th player from Briscola2PPile
        Parameters:
        i - the player's index, should be either the public final int PLAYER0 or PLAYER1 provided by this class
        pile - the pile represented as a Briscola2PPile object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid index is specified

      • setBriscolaSuit

        void setBriscolaSuit(java.lang.String briscolaSuit)
        Sets briscola suit.
        Parameters:
        briscolaSuit - the briscola suit, should be among NeapolitanCardSuit enum values

      • setPile

        void setPile(int i,
             java.lang.String pile)
        Set pile of the i-th player from String
        Parameters:
        i - the player's index, should be either the public final int PLAYER0 or PLAYER1 provided by this class
        pile - String representing the pile, format as specified in the slides
